note: Rocketium 的客户包括 Urban Company、CasaOne、BigBasket、Cure.fit 和 Meesho。它说在其平台上制作的视觉效果被 1 亿最终用户看到。其最新一轮融资使 Rocketium 迄今为止的融资总额达到 420 万美元，其中包括来自 Blume Ventures 和 1Crowd 的 100 万美元种子轮融资。 Rocketium 的平台目前只接受邀请，并计划在 2022 年开放自助服务使用和购买，以及与电子商务和广告平台的更多集成（其目前的集成包括 Salesforce、Mailchimp、YouTube、Vimeo、Wistia 和 Hubspot）。为了使用 Rocketium，设计团队在 Photoshop 或 After Effects 中创建了一组核心模板并将它们导入平台。然后Rocketium针对不同场景定制广告。例如，如果零售商在某些地区开展有针对性的免费送货活动，他们将该信息输入电子表格，Rocketium 会自动更新模板中的文本。然后针对不同平台对广告和视频进行格式化，例如用于网络广告的横幅或用于 Instagram 的方形格式。 Rocketium 的客户之一，健身应用程序 curure.fit，使用它每月针对不同的会员计划运行大约五到六次活动。该平台使 cur.fit 能够减少视觉内容的制作时间，并根据用户的兴趣、人口统计和位置来个性化活动。其他帮助营销团队创建视觉广告活动的公司包括 Canva、InVideo 和 Lumen5。联合创始人兼首席执行官 Satej Sirur 告诉 TechCrunch，Rocketium 专为需要每月创建成百上千个广告、视频和其他创意内容的客户而设计，并且一次可用于创建多达 10,000 个视觉效果。 Canva、InVideo 和 Lumen5 提供模板，而 Rocketium 更专注于想要从 PhotoShop 和 After Effects 导入自己的设计的用户。在一份声明中，Emergent Ventures 创始人兼合伙人 Ankur Jain 表示：“从大容量内容制作到数据驱动的活动优化，Rocketium 正在挑战传统的组织孤岛，以提供真正受到绩效营销人员和设计师等人喜爱和依赖的产品。”
note_en:
Rocketium’s clients include Urban Company, CasaOne, BigBasket, cure.fit and Meesho. It says visuals made on its platform are seen by 100 million end users. Its latest funding brings Rocketium’s total raised so far to $4.2 million, including a $1 million seed round from Blume Ventures and 1Crowd.
 Rocketium’s platform is currently invite-only and it plans to open self-service usage and purchases in 2022, along with more integrations with e-commerce and advertising platforms (its current integrations include Salesforce, Mailchimp, YouTube, Vimeo, Wistia and Hubspot).
  To use Rocketium, design teams create a core set of templates in Photoshop or After Effects and import them to the platform. Then Rocketium customizes ads for different scenarios. For example, if a retailer is running a targeted campaign with free shipping in certain areas, they enter that information into a spreadsheet and Rocketium automatically updates the text in the templates. Then ads and videos are formatted for different platforms, like banners for web advertising or square format for Instagram.
  One of Rocketium’s clients, fitness app cure.fit, uses it to  run about five to six campaigns each month for different membership plans. The platform enables cure.fit to reduce the production time for visual content and personalize campaigns based on users’ interests, demographics and locations.
   Other companies that help marketing teams create visual advertising campaigns include Canva, InVideo and Lumen5. Co-founder and chief executive officer Satej Sirur told TechCrunch that Rocketium was designed specifically for clients that need to create hundreds or thousands of ads, video and other creative content a month, and can be used to create up to 10,000 visuals at a time.
  While Canva, InVideo and Lumen5 provide templates, Rocketium is more focused on users who want to import their own designs from PhotoShop and After Effects.
 In a statement, Emergent Ventures founder and partner Ankur Jain said, “From high-volume content production to data-driven campaign optimization, Rocketium is challenging traditional organizational silos to deliver a product that is truly loved and relied on by performance marketers and designers alike.”
title: Rocketium 融资 320 万美元，帮助创意团队开展大规模营销活动
title_en: Rocketium raises $3.2M to help creative teams create massive marketing campaigns

note:
世界已经真正觉醒到了去中心化通信的时代。美国国会正在发布 ACCESS 法案，以加强平台之间的互操作性和数据可移植性；欧盟正在为此推进《数字市场法案》——德国国家医疗保健系统已公布其计划，将 Matrix 上的 150,000 个医疗保健组织标准化。正是在这种背景下，我们非常高兴地宣布 Element 已经筹集了 3000 万美元的 B 系列资金，以彻底改变应用程序的可用性，构建主要的新功能，扩展企业市场并使 Matrix 完全成为主流！这轮融资由我们在 Protocol Labs 的老朋友（libp2p、IPFS、Filecoin 等的创造者）和 Metaplanet 领投，Metaplanet 是由 Skype 联合创始人 Jaan Tallinn 设立的投资基金。 Automattic 和 Notion 也参与了这一轮，将他们对 Element 的现有投资加倍。我们想不出比 Protocol Labs 和 Metaplanet 更好的新投资者来支持 Element 的使命。 Protocol Labs 毫无疑问是去中心化运动的领导者：只要我们一直致力于将 Matrix 作为去中心化通信层，他们就一直忙于构建 IPFS 作为互联网的去中心化存储层。在 Element 诞生之前，他们就一直在 Matrix 上（Vector 是最早完全托管在 IPFS 上的应用程序之一！），我们迫不及待地想在未来与他们更密切地合作，尽管技术只会在显然是对我们来说正确的技术决策——例如，Element（和 Matrix）不会很快使用加密货币激励措施。与此同时，Metaplanet 是最具前瞻性的投资基金之一——当他们说他们的投资主题是“支持可以为人类带来巨大回报的新颖和循证创新”时，他们并不是在开玩笑。换句话说，他们投资于那些为了让世界变得更美好而做出疯狂破坏性长期事情的人——在我们的例子中，是通过民主化交流使私人交流成为所有人的基本人权。除此之外，Jaan 构建 Skype（他负责聊天！）的经历与我们对 Matrix 的追求之间也存在明显的大量重叠。许多人忘记了 Skype 最初是一个庞大且成功的去中心化通信应用程序——实际上是完全点对点的，建立在与 Kazaa 相同的技术上。随着 P2P Matrix 工作的进展，从构建 Skype 的经验中吸取教训会很棒。这笔投资也非常具体地反映了 Matrix 和 Element 的进步和成熟，以及越来越注重隐私的市场。仅在过去的六个月中，我们就在 EMS 上为 Slack 和 Teams（以及 Telegram 和 Discord）推出了桥梁，在企业市场上获得了真正的吸引力 - 很快就会有更多。与此同时，事实证明，Element Home 在想要拥有自己的服务器的朋友和家人中很受欢迎。与此同时，在更广阔的 Matrix 世界中，我们看到世界上最大的开源会议 FOSDEM 通过 Matrix 实现虚拟化（在 660 多个演讲中有超过 30,000 名与会者），激发了许多其他开源项目的加入。最后，Spaces 的 Beta 版发布了一场风暴——终于让用户可以将他们的房间分成组甚至层次结构，很快就会退出 Beta 版！
在公共部门，越来越多的政府和非政府组织（希望很快宣布！）正在加入英国、美国、法国和德国的行列，建立 Matrix。就在上周，我们看到了德国国家卫生机构 gematik，它宣布德国的所有医疗保健部门都将使用 Matrix 来发送消息。私营部门也在迎头赶上，意识到将所有未加密的对话交给微软和 Salesforce (Slack) 可能不是最好的举措。在其他地方，我们看到越来越多的用户意识到 Element 是 Discord 的绝佳安全替代品——或者是 WhatsApp 的去中心化替代品。坦率地说，作为一家公司，如果我们愿意，Element 在这一点上可以自给自足，通过来自 EMS 托管、EMS 服务和法国和德国等国家级部署的支持合同的收入为基本的 Matrix 和 Element 开发提供资金。公共网络现在拥有超过 3500 万可寻址用户，分布在约 7 万个部署中，我们正在与其他 10 多个国家/地区合作，以将他们也加入进来。矩阵就在这里。然而，在大流行、对 WhatsApp 隐私政策变化的反应，甚至监管机构现在都意识到这些平台垄断是多么不健康的事实之间：过去 18 个月很明显，安全的分散通信已成为一项生存要求，我们应该这样做尽我们所能加快我们剩余的工作。很简单，世界现在需要Matrix。运行 Matrix 服务器应该像运行 Web 服务器一样简单明了。 Element 使用起来应该非常令人愉快，以至于它推动了 Matrix 的采用以获得临界质量并迅速爆发。因此，我们有意识地决定主动筹集这笔新资金，以加速 Element 的增长，并尽快将数据主权带给大众。实际上，这意味着我们要在核心工作上加倍努力：使 Element 尽可能地精致和流畅——引入更多的设计师和产品可用性专家来帮助我们挖掘应用程序中剩余的漏洞；添加剩余的核心缺失功能：空格、线程、固定消息、加星标的消息、自定义表情符号等。在 Matrix 方面，让 Synapse 服务器成为运行的乐趣，并在下一代服务器 Dendrite 上继续开发。我们还组建了专门的团队，专注于完善我们的端到端加密、VoIP/VR、信任与安全以及 P2P 计划。简而言之，对于 Element 和 Matrix，我们正在全面招聘 - 因此，如果您想构建 Web 缺少的通信层，请与我们联系！看到自 2017 年 7 月成立 Element 以来 Matrix 已经走了多远，这有点令人眼花缭乱，但几乎感觉我们仍处于起步阶段。我们正处于 Element 不受控制地在我们的计算机和手机上爆炸的风口浪尖，其方式与 Netscape 在 Web 的早期所做的或电子邮件在早期的 Internet 上所做的几乎相同。想象一个所有服务器都默认带有 Matrix 主服务器的世界，就像今天它们带有邮件传输代理一样——或者是一个点对点世界，其中 Element 的每个副本都嵌入了自己的服务器：用户对他们的对话拥有完全的数字主权。
随着我们向这个美丽的新世界转变，接下来的几个月将证明是至关重要的。新资金将用于将 Element 的抛光提升到一个新的水平——同时全额资助 P2P Matrix 工作、去中心化 VoIP/视频会议和去中心化声誉。这应该是 Matrix 和 Element 的一个步骤变化，我们要感谢 Protocol Labs、Metaplanet、Automattic 和 Notion 为其提供燃料！
note_en:
The world has truly woken up to the age of decentralised communication. The US congress is releasing the  ACCESS Act bill to enforce interoperability and data portability between platforms; the EU is pushing forwards with the  Digital Markets Act for the same - and the German national healthcare system has  published its plan to standardise 150,000 healthcare organisations on Matrix.
 It’s against this backdrop that we are incredibly excited to announce that Element has raised $30M of Series B funding in order to revolutionise the app’s usability, build out major new features, expand in the enterprise market and take Matrix fully mainstream!
 The round is led by our long-standing friends at  Protocol Labs (the creators of  libp2p,  IPFS,  Filecoin and more) alongside  Metaplanet - the investment fund set up by Jaan Tallinn, co-founder of Skype.  Automattic and  Notion are also participating in the round, doubling down on their existing investments in Element.
  We cannot think of better new investors to support Element’s mission than Protocol Labs and Metaplanet.  Protocol Labs is unquestionably a leader of the decentralisation movement: they have been busy building out IPFS as the decentralised storage layer of the Internet for as long as we’ve been working away on Matrix as the decentralised communication layer. They’ve been on Matrix since before Element was born (Vector was one of the first apps entirely hosted on IPFS!), and we cannot wait to work more closely with them in future, although technology will only be shared if it is clearly the right technical decision for us - for instance, Element (and Matrix) is not going to use cryptocurrency incentives any time soon.
 Meanwhile,  Metaplanet is one of the most forward thinking investment funds out there - they’re not joking when they say that their investment thesis is to “support novel and evidence based innovation that could produce an outsized return for the benefit of humankind”.  In other words, they invest in folks who are doing crazy disruptive long-term things to make the world a better place - in our case, democratising communication to make private communication a basic human right for all.  Beyond that, there’s also the obvious massive overlap between Jaan’s experiences building out Skype (where he was responsible for chat!) and our quest with Matrix.  Many people forget that Skype was originally a massive and successful decentralised communications app - and in fact fully peer-to-peer, built on the same tech as Kazaa. It will be fantastic to learn from the lessons of building Skype as P2P Matrix work progresses.
 The investment is also a very concrete reflection of Matrix and Element’s progress and maturity, and an increasingly privacy conscious market.
  These last six months alone have seen us gain real traction in the enterprise market with the launch of bridges for Slack and Teams (and Telegram and Discord) on EMS - with more to come shortly.  At the same time, Element Home is proving popular for friends and family wanting their own servers.  Meanwhile in the wider Matrix world we saw the world’s biggest open source conference  FOSDEM go virtual via Matrix (with over 30K attendees across 660+ talks), inspiring many other open source projects to hop on board.  Finally, the beta release of Spaces has gone down a storm - at last letting users curate their rooms into groups and even hierarchies, and soon to exit beta!
 In the public sector, more and more governments and NGOs (hopefully to be announced soon!) are joining the UK, the US, France and Germany in building on Matrix. Only last week we saw gematik, the German national health agency announce  all of Germany's healthcare will use Matrix for messaging going forwards. The private sector is catching up too, realising that handing over all their unencrypted conversations to Microsoft and Salesforce (Slack) may not be the best move.  Elsewhere, we see more and more users realising that Element is an excellent secure alternative to Discord - or a decentralised alternative to WhatsApp.
 Speaking candidly, as a company, Element could be self-sufficient at this point if we wanted to, funding basic Matrix and Element development via revenue from EMS hosting, EMS services, and support contracts for nation-scale deployments such as France and Germany. The public network now has over 35M addressable users spread over ~70K deployments, and we’re working with over 10 other countries to bring them on board too. Matrix is here to stay.
  However, between the pandemic, the reactions to WhatsApp’s privacy policy changes, and the fact even regulators now realise how unhealthy these platform monopolies are: it’s become clear over the last 18 months that secure decentralised communication has become an existential requirement, and we should do everything we can to speed up our remaining work.  Quite simply, the world needs Matrix  now.  Running a Matrix server should be as straightforward and as commonplace as running a web server. Element should be so delightful to use that it drives Matrix adoption to gain critical mass and explode virally.
 So we consciously made the decision to proactively raise this new funding in order to accelerate Element’s growth, and bring data sovereignty to the masses as quickly as we possibly can.
 Practically speaking, this means doubling down on our core work: making Element as polished and slick as possible - bringing in more designers and product usability specialists to help dig us out of the remaining holes in the app; adding the remaining core missing features: spaces, threading, pinned messages, starred messages, custom emoji and more. On the Matrix side, making the Synapse server a joy to run, and continuing development on Dendrite, the next-gen server.  We are also filling out dedicated teams to focus exclusively on refining our End-to-end Encryption, VoIP / VR, Trust & Safety and P2P initiatives.
 In short, for both Element and Matrix, we’re hiring across the board - so if you want to build the missing communication layer of the Web, please  get in touch!
  It’s a bit dizzying to see how far Matrix has come since we set up Element in July 2017, and yet it almost feels like we are still at the beginning.  We’re at the cusp of Element uncontrollably exploding across our computers and phones in much the same manner that Netscape once did in the early days of the Web - or email did over the early Internet.  It’s not implausible to think of a world where all servers come with a Matrix homeserver by default, much as they come with a mail transfer agent today - or a peer-to-peer world where every copy of Element embeds its own server: giving the user total digital sovereignty over their conversations.
 The coming months will prove critical as we transform towards this brave new world. The new funds will be spent on taking Element's polish to the next level - while fully funding P2P Matrix work, Decentralised VoIP/Video conferencing and Decentralised Reputation at last. This should be a step change for Matrix and for Element, and we’d like to thank Protocol Labs, Metaplanet, Automattic and Notion for providing the fuel to power it!
title: 随着 Matrix 的爆发，Element 筹集了 3000 万美元

note: 不要错过。注册并成为第一个获得诺基亚手机新闻和优惠的人。 HMD Global Oy 是诺基亚手机和平板电脑品牌的独家授权商。诺基亚是诺基亚公司的注册商标。 Android、Google 和其他相关标志和徽标是 Google LLC 的商标。可能适用于提供的变化。检查本地可用性。所提供的所有规格、功能和其他产品信息如有更改，恕不另行通知。图片仅供参考。 1 提供一次免费更换屏幕，如果您在购买后的第一年内损坏它。 3 5G 覆盖范围有限，您的网络服务提供商可能不支持。实际速度取决于网络和其他因素。 4 Google Assistant 不适用于某些语言和国家/地区。在 https://support.google.com/assistant 查看可用性。 © 2021 HMD Global。版权所有。诺基亚是诺基亚公司的注册商标。 HMD Global Oy 是诺基亚手机和平板电脑品牌的独家授权商。
note_en:

 HMD Global Oy is the exclusive licensee of the Nokia brand for phones and tablets. Nokia is a registered trademark of Nokia Corporation. title: 诺基亚 XR20 手机

note:
最新一轮使 Onto 的总资金达到 2.45 亿美元。瑞典风投 Alfvén & Didrikson 领投这轮股权融资，英国投资公司 Pollen Street Capital 提供高级担保资产支持的债务工具，这可能意味着 Onto 的 3,000 多辆电动汽车将用作抵押品。 Onto 没有透露这轮融资中有多少来自股权与债务。这家汽车即服务公司正在寻找社会对订阅服务日益增长的崇拜与立法推动的电动汽车采用之间的最佳平衡点。与许多其他国家一样，英国正在禁止到 2030 年销售内燃机新车，因此越来越多的人正在寻找转向电动汽车的方法。从天然气到电力的转变正在加速。根据汽车制造商和贸易商协会的数据，2020 年全电动和插电式混合动力汽车的新注册在英国的市场份额为 10.7%。这比 2019 年的 6.6% 有所上升。该组织指出，电池和插电式混合动力汽车的注册量合计超过十分之一，高于 2019 年的大约 30 分之一。购买汽车通常被认为是最糟糕的投资之一你（们）能做到;它是一种资产，一旦客户通过融资购买它，就会贬值和花钱。然而，英国每年有数百万辆新车销售。由于市场规模如此之大，Onto 创始人兼首席执行官 Rob Jolly 认为，有足够的空间使订阅业务成为可持续且有利可图的业务。 “我们的总拥有成本与拥有自己的汽车非常相似，但您不必担心收费或服务，”乔利告诉 TechCrunch。 “棒球场的费用是每月 330 英镑（约 450 美元）。没有预付定金，这是巨大的。我们正在努力做的是消除所有障碍，让人们更容易认识到订阅汽车实际上比购买汽油或柴油汽车更容易、更实惠。”简单浏览 Onto 的网站，就会发现 330 英镑的球场仅适用于公司车队中较低级别的某些汽车。中档可能是标致 450 英镑（~622 美元）或现代 560 英镑（~775 美元），高档可能是捷豹或特斯拉，1299 英镑（~1,800 美元）。例如，如果我们计算租赁现代 Kona 的数字，就不清楚 Onto 的服务是否更便宜。在英国租用这辆车可能会在四年内为客户每年花费 9,888 英镑，首付为 2,152 英镑。英国电动汽车的平均保险费用为 2,264 英镑。普通人每天开私家车行驶 35 英里，而现代科纳的续航里程约为 245 英里，所以你真的只需要每周充满电一次。为电池充电的平均成本约为 10 英镑，因此您每年的充电费用约为 520 英镑。电动汽车的维护很少，通常包含在租赁协议中。算起来，你会在四年内得到大约 15,000 英镑（~20,700 美元）的数字。以每月 560 英镑的价格计算，Onto 的服务在同一四年期间将使客户花费 26,880 英镑（约合 37,145 美元）。考虑到英国的插电式汽车补助金，您可以以 27,950 英镑（约合 38,620 美元）的价格购买这辆车。
这当然更像是一种高端服务，其优势在于便利性和灵活性。 Onto 的定价肯定与其他电动汽车订阅业务相当，例如北美的 Steer。旧金山的 Flux 明显更便宜，以每月 600 美元的价格提供 Teslas，但它不包括 Onto 提供的“全包”服务，如道路税和保险。诚然，在英国，电动车车主实际上不必支付道路税。 Onto 表示，订阅中包括的其他内容包括车辆送货上门，以及通过网络合作伙伴（如 BP Pulse、Tesla Supercharger、InstaVolt 以及截至今年早些时候的 Shell Recharge）免费充电。该公司与 10 个汽车品牌建立了合作伙伴关系，并出租了 12 种不同的电动汽车车型，并且正在巩固更多汽车制造商的合作伙伴关系。 Jolly 不会分享有关未来合作伙伴关系的细节。但是，该公司网站的更新显示了最近添加的要预订的车型，这表明大众汽车及其 2021 e-Up!将是最新的。 Jolly 表示，大众可能需要一段时间才能同时接受电动汽车和订阅服务，但他相信，为客户提供可随时取消的白手套服务会使选择变得尽可能简单。事实上，乔利说 Onto 几乎是盈利的，这在公司计划每三到六个月将其团队规模扩大一倍的计划中很明显，该团队目前有 70 名员工。 Onto 的主要投资者 Alfvén & Didrikson (A&D) 通常投资于更多 SaaS 业务，具有长期投资结构。 A&D 合伙人蒂亚姆·阿夫沙里 (Tiyam Afshari) 表示，这使得 VC 能够对像 Onto 这样需要大量前期成本的企业进行更大的赌注。 “我们很高兴接受我们看到正在改变行业的那些赌注，”Afshari 告诉 TechCrunch。 “如果您了解拥有汽车所带来的所有麻烦，订阅作为汽车所有权的一种形式是轻而易举的。因此，我们非常强烈地认为，订阅模式应该并且将会发展成为融资行业的重要组成部分，而 Onto 处于利用这一点的主要位置。”鉴于其主要投资者对 Onto 的长期押注，可以看出该公司在寻求向英国以外的地区扩张时可能将目光投向瑞典 毕竟，斯堪的纳维亚人采用电动汽车的速度比其他国家快，而挪威的另一项电动汽车订阅服务 imove ，最近在 A 系列中筹集了 1900 万美元。对于许多用户来说，电动汽车订阅服务不仅仅是不必担心路税、汽车保险和服务等问题。这是关于跟上最新电动汽车模型的灵活性。
“iPhone 每年都会更新，因为技术在进步，电池寿命也略有改善，”乔利说。 “同样的事情将会发生，而且已经发生在电动汽车上。我们看到这就是千禧一代现在拥有的汽车。他们可以更换最新最好的汽车，即使它只是一辆额外行驶 30 英里的汽车。这在我们的客户中非常普遍。”对于 32 岁的东德文郡的西蒙史密斯来说，从来没有尝试过最新的汽车。由于道德和经济原因，他于 2019 年加入 Onto 的服务，并发现雷诺 Zoe ZE40 的不同版本完全满足他的需求。 “对我来说，这仍然是最实惠的电动驾驶方式，”史密斯告诉 TechCrunch。 “我真的很想使用电动汽车，但在 2019 年没有任何明显的方法可以做到这一点或实现它，而且我想说它在英国仍然相当有限如果你想使用电动汽车，你可能必须即使买二手也能省下一大笔钱，然后你就没有灵活性了。”史密斯说，对于那些想在购买前试用的人来说，使用 Onto 也是一种很好的方法，这无疑是特斯拉、现代、捷豹、奥迪和标致等汽车制造商有兴趣合作的部分原因。 “同样，这是一个巨大的市场，我们可以与汽车制造商和经销商携手并进，在其他方面，我们是人们现在购买汽车的众多方法之一，”乔利说.现有投资者 Legal and General、Campden Hill Capital 和 JamJar 也参与了本轮融资，以及来自 TotalEnergies Ventures、Vlerick Group、荷兰保险公司 Achmea Innovation Fund 和 Jim O'Neill 家族办公室的新投资。 Lazard 担任 Onto 的财务顾问。
note_en:
This latest round brings Onto’s total funding to $245 million.  Swedish VC Alfvén & Didrikson is leading the round on the equity raise, and British investment company Pollen Street Capital is providing a senior-secured asset-backed debt facility, which likely means Onto’s fleet of over 3,000 electric vehicles will be used as collateral. Onto did not disclose how much of the round came from equity versus debt.
 The car-as-a-service company is finding that sweet spot between society’s growing adoration for subscription services and EV adoption driven by legislation. The U.K., like many other countries, is banning internal combustion engine new car sales by 2030, so more people are looking for ways to make the switch to electric.
  That shift from gas to electric is accelerating. New registrations of all-electric  and plug-in hybrid vehicles had a market share of 10.7% in the UK in 2020,  according to the Society of Motor Manufacturers and Traders. That’s up from 6.6% in 2019. The organization noted that battery and plug-in hybrid electric cars together accounted for more than one in 10 registrations, up from around one in 30 in 2019.
 Buying a car is often considered one of the worst investments you can make; it’s an asset that both depreciates and costs money the moment a customer buys it through financing. Yet there are millions of new car sales each year in the U.K. With a market size that large, Onto founder and CEO Rob Jolly thinks there’s plenty of room to make the subscriptions business a sustainable and profitable one.
 “Our total cost of ownership is very comparable with having your own car but you don’t have to worry about charging fees or servicing,” Jolly told TechCrunch. “The ballpark cost is £330 (~$450) per month. There’s no upfront deposit, which is huge. What we’re trying to do is remove all the barriers and actually make it easier for people to recognize that having a car on subscription is actually easier and more affordable than having a petrol or diesel car.”
 A brief glance at  Onto’s website shows that the  £330 ballpark is only accurate for certain cars at the lower range of the company’s fleet. The middle range could be a Peugeot at £450 (~$622) or a Hyundai at £560 (~$775), and high range could be a Jaguar or Tesla at £1299 (~$1,800).
 If we crunch the numbers for leasing a Hyundai Kona, for example, it’s not clear that Onto’s service is cheaper.  A lease for this vehicle in the U.K. could cost a customer annually  £9,888 over a four year period with a down payment of £2,152. The  average cost of insurance for EVs in the U.K. is £2,264. The  average person travels 35 miles by personal car per day, and the Hyundai Kona has a range of about 245 miles, so you really only need to fully charge it once a week. The  average cost of charging the battery is about  £10, so you’re looking at about £520 per year on charging. Maintenance for electric vehicles is minimal and usually included in a lease agreement. Tally it up and you get a number in the ballpark of £15,000 (~$20,700) over four years. At £560 per month, Onto’s service would cost a customer £26,880 (~$37,145) over the same four year period. When factoring in U.K.’s plug-in car grant, you could  buy the car for £27,950 (~$38,620).
 It’s certainly more of a high-end service, and the premium is on the convenience and flexibility. Onto’s pricing is certainly comparable to other EV subscription businesses, like  Steer in North America. Flux, in San Francisco, is markedly cheaper, offering Teslas for $600 per month, but it doesn’t include the “all-inclusive” services like road tax and insurance that Onto does. Granted, in the U.K., EV owners don’t actually have to pay for road tax.
 Among other things Onto says are included in a subscription are home delivery on its vehicles and access to free charging via network partners like BP Pulse, Tesla Supercharger, InstaVolt and as of earlier this year   Shell Recharge . The company has partnerships with 10 car brands and rents out 12 different EV models, and is in the process of firming up more automaker partnerships. Jolly wouldn’t share specifics on future partnerships. However, updates to the company’s website, which shows most recent additions of car models to book, suggest Volkswagen and its 2021 e-Up! will be the latest.
  Jolly said it might take a while for the masses to catch on to both EVs and subscriptions, but he’s confident that offering customers a white-glove service that can be canceled anytime makes the choice as easy as possible. In fact, Jolly said Onto is very nearly profitable, and that’s evident in the company’s plans to double its team size, which is currently at 70 staff members, every three to six months.
 Onto’s lead investor, Alfvén & Didrikson (A&D), which usually invests in more SaaS businesses, has a long term investing structure. This has allowed the VC to take bigger bets on businesses like Onto’s that requires large upfront costs, according to Tiyam Afshari, partner at A&D.
 “We’re happy to take those bets that we see are transforming an industry,” Afshari told TechCrunch. “Subscription as a form of ownership when it comes to cars is just a no-brainer if you look at all the hassle that comes from owning a car. So we feel quite strongly that the subscription model should and will grow to quite a significant part of the financing industry, and Onto is in a prime position to capitalize on that.”
 Given its lead investor’s long term bet on Onto, it’s perceivable that the company might look towards Sweden as it seeks to expand outside the U.K. After all, the Scandinavians have taken to EVs faster than other countries, and another EV subscription service in Norway,   imove, recently raised $19 million in a Series A.
 For many users, the EV subscription service isn’t just about not having to worry about things like road tax, auto insurance and servicing. It’s about the flexibility of keeping up with the latest EV models.
 “The iPhone has updates every year because the tech is improving and the battery life gets slightly better,” said Jolly. “The same thing is going to happen and already is happening with EVs. We’re seeing that this is car ownership now for millennials. They can swap in for the latest and greatest car when it comes out, even if it’s just a car with 30 miles extra range. And that’s hugely prevalent within our customers.”
 For Simon Smith of East Devon, 32, it’s never been about trying out the newest car. He joined Onto’s service in 2019 for ethical and financial reasons, and has found the different iterations of the Renault Zoe ZE40 to suit his needs entirely.
 “It’s still the most affordable way for me to drive electric,” Smith told TechCrunch. “I really wanted to go electric, but there wasn’t any obvious way of doing that or making that happen in 2019, and I would say it’s still fairly limited in the U.K. If you wanted to go electric, you’d probably have to save up a good deal of money even to buy second hand, and then you just wouldn’t have the flexibility.”
 Smith says using Onto is a good approach for people who want to try before they buy, as well, which is no doubt at least partly why automakers like Tesla, Hyundai, Jaguar, Audi and Peugeot are interested in partnering up.
 “Again, it’s an enormous market, of which we can kind of sit hand-in-hand with the car manufacturers and dealerships and the other aspects where we are one of a number of methods people have of acquiring the car now,” said Jolly.
 Existing investors Legal and General, Campden Hill Capital and JamJar also participated in the equity round, alongside new investments from TotalEnergies Ventures, Vlerick Group, Dutch insurer Achmea Innovation Fund and the family office of Jim O’Neill. Lazard acted as financial advisor to Onto.
title: Onto 在 B 轮融资 1.75 亿美元以扩展英国的电动汽车订阅服务
title_en: Onto raises $175 million in Series B to expand EV subscription service in the UK

note:
在南非，这些企业贡献了该国国内生产总值的三分之一左右。去年，冠状病毒大流行威胁到其中一些中小企业的生存，其影响持续存在，因为业主担心收入、销售和现金流。自 2013 年推出以来，南非金融科技 Yoco 已将自己定位为该国商家进行线下支付的首选平台。今天，该公司宣布获得 8300 万美元的 C 轮融资，以扩大线下和线上产品的规模并扩展到新市场。尽管南非的卡和移动普及率超过 70%，但该国的中小企业仍然难以接受卡。事实证明，Yoco 的便携式卡片机在解决这个问题方面非常出色；三年前，当 TechCrunch 在 B 轮融资 1600 万美元后报道该公司时，使用其平台的商户只有 3 万多家。现在，这个数字增加了五倍。随着 Yoco 在提供离线支付方面呈指数级增长，它建立了在线产品。在测试了一段时间后，在去年 3 月南非封锁的几天后，推出及时。这样，南非商家就可以继续在平台上接受付款。 “我们希望提供商家需要的任何支付方式。我们确实从面对面的支付领域开始，专注于终端，这是最大的需求所在，”首席商务官 Carl Wazen 说。 “但这场大流行对如此多依赖面对面交易的企业产生了毁灭性影响，加速了企业接受在线支付的需求。”根据 Yoco 的小型企业脉搏监测器，在南非封锁最严重的时期，-100 到 100 之间的中小企业所有者的情绪在 2020 年第二季度降至历史最低点 -12。此后，随着封锁的放松，情况有所改善，使企业可以更自由地行动并继续面对面付款。因此，Yoco 的在线支付只占平台上交易的一小部分。但这并不是说人们用现金进行交易。据 Wazen 称，事实上，情况恰恰相反。 Wazen 说，他注意到的一种大流行后行为是，一旦解除封锁，人们就会以更快的方式回来亲自付款，因为他们不再使用现金。 “最近的消费者行为表明不再使用现金，企业必须迅速适应这种变化。这提供了一个巨大的机会，我们的使命是支持这种转变，”他补充道。
今年早些时候，首席执行官 Katlego Maphai 表示，Yoco 正在寻求将其服务扩展到数字支付的其他方面。他将移动货币、二维码支付和电子资金转账 (ETF) 列为正在筹备中的产品。 Wazen 证实了这一点，但没有提供有关公司在这些产品方面的最新情况。然而，他确实提到，该公司仍然是一家以卡为中心的支付提供商。作为南非最重要的信用卡支付提供商，Yoco 的战略在于创造接入和消除采用数字金融服务的障碍。该公司通过专注于 Wazen 声称对中小型企业最全面的产品功能来做到这一点。他补充说，就市场占有率而言，Yoco也是商家最容易通过不同渠道无缝访问服务的地方。 “我们有一个现在得到认可的品牌。这就是我们获胜的方式，它是关于尽可能专注于市场的那部分，在我们看来，像其他竞争对手一样的人没有足够关注。”南非有超过 600 万家小企业仍然只用现金进行交易；这为 Yoco 提供了巨大的机会。据该公司称，从 3 月到 2020 年 7 月，完全无现金的小企业数量增长了 300%。 Yoco 目前为其中 150,000 家企业提供服务，每天增加 500 多家商户。该公司声称每年处理超过 10 亿美元的信用卡支付，在其成立的六年中，它处理了超过 20 亿美元的信用卡支付。 Yoco 总共筹集了 1.07 亿美元。该公司的 C 系列投资是南非同类投资中规模最大的，也是非洲金融科技领域最大的投资之一（仅次于 Flutterwave 和 Chipper Cash）。 Wazen 还声称它是中东和非洲任何以小型企业为重点的支付平台中最大的。 Yoco 目前是非洲大陆最有价值的初创公司之一，作为一家金融科技初创公司，这并不奇怪。该行业继续主导着非洲的创业风险投资资金，而其重量级人物则将首次投资者带到非洲大陆。在 Yoco 的案例中，它是本轮的主要投资者 Dragoneer Investment Group。该基金以支持 Chime、Klarna、Nubank、Mercado Libre 和 Square 等金融科技巨头而闻名。
其他参与的投资者包括新投资者 Breyer Capital、HOF Capital、The Raba Partnership、4DX Ventures 和 TO Ventures；以及现有投资者 Partech、Velocity Capital Fintech Ventures、Orange Ventures 和 Quona Capital。 Coinbase、Revolut、Spotify 和 Gojek 等全球科技公司的现任和前任高管也参加了此次会议。 “与 Yoco 团队合作，我们非常兴奋，”Dragoneer 私人投资联席主管 Christian Jensen 在一份声明中表示。 “在 Dragoneer，我们寻找优秀的团队，他们正在建立具有出色经济模型的持久业务，而这正是我们在 Yoco 找到的。 Yoco 已经受到客户的喜爱，该公司正在投资的产品路线图将为商家带来更多价值。虽然国内有巨大的持续增长空间，但 Yoco 的机会远远超出了南非。” Wazen 指出，Yoco 的业务蓬勃发展有三个核心推动因素。一是产品能力，二是平台，三是市场占有率。这项投资将加速这三者的发展。 Yoco 正在从纯粹的支付接受游戏转变为产品方面的完整金融生态系统。平台游戏将使 Yoco 继续整合并利用监管放松的垂直优势，并且 Yoco 正在深化其在南非的市场占有率。虽然 Wazen 认为 Yoco 在南非还没有触及皮毛，但他期待在非洲和中东的其他地区复制其增长。在这两个地区有超过 1 亿的中小企业以现金进行交易，Yoco 计划在未来四年内至少达到 100 万。为了实现这一目标，Yoco 将在明年将其远程团队以及在开普敦和阿姆斯特丹的办公室中增加 200 人。该公司还利用了当前的趋势，即非洲的独角兽和独角兽从全球公司雇用前高级员工，将他们的规模扩大到新的高度。虽然没有提及姓名，但 Yoco 的一些新员工包括 Monzo 的前产品副总裁、Paypal 的前产品营销总监和优步的前通讯主管。该公司还任命了一位新董事长，即金融科技独角兽 Pagseguro 的前董事总经理胡安·富恩特斯 (Juan Fuentes)。
note_en:
In South Africa, these businesses contribute around one-third of the country’s GDP. Last year, the coronavirus pandemic threatened the existence of some of these SMEs, and its effects linger as owners worry about revenue, sales and cash flow.
 Since launching in 2013, South African fintech  Yoco has positioned itself as the go-to platform to access offline payments among merchants in the country. Today, the company is announcing $83 million in Series C funding to scale offline and online offerings and expand to new markets.
  Despite South Africa’s high card and mobile penetration rates of over 70%, the country’s SMEs still struggle to accept cards. Yoco’s portable card machines have proved masterful in solving this problem; when TechCrunch  covered the company three years ago after its $16 million Series B raise, it had little over 30,000 merchants using its platform. Now, that number has quintupled.
  As Yoco grew exponentially in providing offline payments, it built an online offering. After being in beta for a while, the rollout came right on time some days into South Africa’s lockdown in March last year. This way, South African merchants could continue accepting payments on the platform.
 “We want to offer whatever payment methods our merchants need. And we did start in the in-person payment space, focusing on terminals, which was where the biggest demand was,” chief business officer  Carl Wazen said. “But the pandemic, which had a devastating effect on so many businesses that relied on in-person trade, accelerated the need for businesses to accept payments online.”
 During the height of the lockdowns in South Africa, sentiment across SMEs owners on a scale of -100 to 100 dropped to an all-time low of -12 in Q2 2020, according to Yoco’s small business pulse monitor. It has since improved following the easing of the lockdowns, allowing businesses to move more freely and continue in-person payments. As a result, Yoco’s online payments account for a minute part of the transactions made on the platform.
 But that’s not to say people are transacting with cash. In fact, it’s the opposite, according to Wazen. Wazen says one post-pandemic behavior he noticed was that once the lockdown was lifted, people came back to make in-person payments in an accelerated way because they stopped using cash. “Recent consumer behavior shows a shift away from cash, and businesses have to rapidly adapt to this change. This presents a huge opportunity, and it is our mission to support that transition,” he added.
 Earlier this year, chief executive  Katlego Maphai said Yoco was looking to expand its services into other aspects of digital payments. He listed mobile money, QR payments and electronic funds transfer (ETF) as offerings in its pipeline. Wazen corroborated this, but didn’t provide an update about where the company is with these offerings. He did mention, however, that the company is still very much a card-focused payment provider.
 Yoco’s strategy as the foremost card payments provider in South Africa lies in creating access and removing barriers to adopting digital financial services. The company does that by focusing on product capabilities that Wazen claims are the most comprehensive for small and medium businesses. He adds that in terms of market presence, Yoco is also the easiest for merchants to access services through different channels seamlessly.
 “We’ve got a brand that is recognized now. That’s how we win and it’s about staying as focused as possible on that part of the market that, in our opinion, people like other competitors are not focused on enough.”
 South Africa has over 6 million small businesses that still transact only in cash; this provides a huge opportunity for Yoco. According to the company, the number of small businesses that were fully cashless jumped 300% from March to July 2020. Yoco currently serves 150,000 of these businesses and adds over 500 merchants per day. The company claims to be processing more than $1 billion in card payments per year, and in its six years of existence, it has processed over $2 billion in card payments.
  Yoco has raised a total of $107 million. The company’s Series C investment is the largest of its kind in South Africa and one of the largest for any African fintech (third only to  Flutterwave and  Chipper Cash). Wazen also claims it is the largest by any small business-focused payments platform in the Middle East and Africa.
 Yoco is currently one of the most valuable startups on the continent, and as a fintech startup, it comes as no surprise. The sector continues to dominate startup venture capital funding in Africa while its heavy hitters bring first-time investors to the continent.
 In Yoco’s case, it’s the lead investor in this round,  Dragoneer Investment Group. The fund has famously backed fintech giants like Chime, Klarna, Nubank, Mercado Libre and Square.
 Other investors that participated include new investors Breyer Capital, HOF Capital, The Raba Partnership, 4DX Ventures and TO Ventures; and existing investors Partech, Velocity Capital Fintech Ventures, Orange Ventures and Quona Capital. Current and former executives from global tech companies such as Coinbase, Revolut, Spotify and Gojek took part as well.
 “We couldn’t be more excited to partner with the Yoco team,” Christian Jensen, co-head of private investments at Dragoneer, said in a statement. “At Dragoneer, we look for great teams that are building durable businesses with wonderful economic models, and that is exactly what we’ve found at Yoco. Yoco is already beloved by customers, and the product roadmap that the company is investing behind will drive even more value for merchants. While there is tremendous room for continued growth domestically, the opportunity for Yoco goes well beyond South Africa.”
 There are three core enablers to Yoco’s thriving business, Wazen pointed out. First is its product capabilities, second is its platform and third is its market presence. This investment will be there to accelerate all three. Yoco is transitioning from a pure payment acceptance play into a full financial ecosystem on the product side. The platform play will see Yoco continue to integrate and take advantage of regulatory easing vertically, and Yoco is deepening its market presence in South Africa.
 While Wazen believes Yoco has barely scratched the surface in South Africa, he’s looking forward to replicating its growth in other parts of Africa and the Middle East. With over 100 million SMEs transacting in cash across both regions, Yoco plans to reach at least a million within the next four years.
 To accomplish this, Yoco is increasing its team by 200 people remotely and across its offices in Cape Town and Amsterdam within the next year. The company is also tapping into a current trend that has seen African soonicorns and unicorns hire former top employees from global companies to scale theirs to new heights. While it doesn’t mention names, some of Yoco’s new hires include a former VP of product at Monzo, a former product marketing director at Paypal and a former head of communications at Uber. The company has also brought on board a new chairman, Juan Fuentes, the former managing director of fintech unicorn Pagseguro.
title: 南非支付初创公司 Yoco 筹集了由 Dragoneer 领投的 8300 万美元 C 轮融资
title_en: South African payments startup Yoco raises $83M Series C led by Dragoneer
